channel.title: NPR Programs: Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Martínez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Judge to decide whether SNAP benefits can be cut off Saturday
item.description: Federal food assistance could be cut off Saturday because of the shutdown. But a federal judge could decide to take steps to ensure federal food assistance keeps flowing.
item.content:encoded: Federal food assistance could be cut off Saturday because of the shutdown. But a federal judge could decide to take steps to ensure federal food assistance keeps flowing.
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Ludden

item.title: Delaware governor on using state money to temporarily fund SNAP benefits
item.description: NPR's A Martinez speaks to Democratic Gov. Matt Meyer of Delaware, who declared a state of emergency to temporarily fund SNAP benefits for his state's recipients of the federal food aid.
item.content:encoded: NPR's A Martinez speaks to Democratic Gov. Matt Meyer of Delaware, who declared a state of emergency to temporarily fund SNAP benefits for his state's recipients of the federal food aid.
item.dc:creator: A Martínez

item.title: With SNAP benefits at risk, U.S. food banks prepare for surge in need
item.description: With millions of Americans at risk of losing access to their federal food benefits Saturday, food banks across the country are finding ways to help those in need.
item.content:encoded: With millions of Americans at risk of losing access to their federal food benefits Saturday, food banks across the country are finding ways to help those in need.
item.dc:creator: Hosts

item.title: Latter-day Saints are having fewer children. Church officials are taking note
item.description: The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints has long emphasized the importance of having children. Now the church says it's worried about the declining birth rate.
item.content:encoded:
The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints has long emphasized the importance of having children. Now the church says it's worried about the declining birth rate.

(Image credit: Ciara Hulet)
item.dc:creator: Ciara Hulet

item.title: Automakers take a hit from tariffs, but some still see strong earnings
item.description: Automakers have been paying billions of dollars in tariffs on imported cars, parts and materials. But on earnings calls this month, some carmakers reported that they're performing well anyway.
item.content:encoded:
Automakers have been paying billions of dollars in tariffs on imported cars, parts and materials. But on earnings calls this month, some carmakers reported that they're performing well anyway.

(Image credit: Bill Pugliano)
item.dc:creator: Camila Domonoske

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: A judge will decide whether access to SNAP benefits can be cut off, pressure increases for lawmakers to end the shutdown, what the U.S. resuming nuclear testing would mean for the country.
item.content:encoded: A judge will decide whether access to SNAP benefits can be cut off, pressure increases for lawmakers to end the shutdown, what the U.S. resuming nuclear testing would mean for the country.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: 'A House of Dynamite' envisions U.S. response to an unknown nuclear threat
item.description: A new film directed by Kathryn Bigelow wonders how the U.S. would react to a nuclear missile launch of undetermined origin heading its way.
item.content:encoded: A new film directed by Kathryn Bigelow wonders how the U.S. would react to a nuclear missile launch of undetermined origin heading its way.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: King Charles III strips Prince Andrew of his titles
item.description: King Charles III is stripping his brother Prince Andrew of his remaining titles and evicting him from his royal residence, following revelations about Andrew's relationship with Jeffrey Epstein.
item.content:encoded: King Charles III is stripping his brother Prince Andrew of his remaining titles and evicting him from his royal residence, following revelations about Andrew's relationship with Jeffrey Epstein.
item.dc:creator: Fatima Al-Kassab

item.title: U.S. healthcare system pushed into spotlight as fight over subsidies continue
item.description: The dispute over extending the Affordable Care Act subsidies is at the center of the shutdown fight, and it's put America's healthcare system at centerstage. So what solutions are lawmakers proposing?
item.content:encoded: The dispute over extending the Affordable Care Act subsidies is at the center of the shutdown fight, and it's put America's healthcare system at centerstage. So what solutions are lawmakers proposing?
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Inside a Michigan town's fight over data centers
item.description: One small town in Michigan is debating whether to allow data centers. It's a topic getting pushback all over the country. The Planet Money team explores the hot button issue.
item.content:encoded: One small town in Michigan is debating whether to allow data centers. It's a topic getting pushback all over the country. The Planet Money team explores the hot button issue.
item.dc:creator: Dustin Dwyer
